data.title: Turrets actively track targets
data.body:
Whilst a turreted unit has a valid target, all turrets will be made to track the target even if it is not ready to attack yet. This means once it becomes ready (e.g. enters range, reloads, etc) it will already be lined up.

Fixes #5203.

data.title: Remove ruleset cache
data.body:
This removes the RulesetCache in favour of a simpler and more perf/memory predictable loading setup:
- The default rules are initialized during the initial load, and stay in memory until mod-exit.
- Custom map rules will always be parsed when loading the map.  Any default sections will use the defaults.
- (after #10901) MapPreviews will cache their custom rules themselves.

The parsing is now done on a background thread, which lets us animate the load screen smoothly during the parsing (currently only ~1/3 â€“ ~1/2 of the load screen duration for me).  I plan on pushing more loading tasks to background threads later.

Depends on #10902.

data.title: RangeMultiplier only affects maximum range.
data.body:
Which can lead to crashes if the `RangeMultiplier`*`Range` value ends up being smaller than `MinRange`. Example case scenario, artillery with a relatively big minimum range under an effect which halves it's range or more.

Example stackdump of such a crash:

```
Attacque Superior Mod at Version {DEV_VERSION}
on map 27a37711fa56b77091e0be5689faaae7455e9973 (DEFCON 6 (2-6) by Westwood Studios).
Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.2.9200.0)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 4.0.30319.42000
Exception of type `System.ArgumentOutOfRangeException`: Maximum range is less than the minimum range.
Parameter name: maxRange
   at OpenRA.Map.<FindTilesInAnnulus>d__25.MoveNext() in d:\OpenRA-AS-dev\OpenRA.Game\Map\Map.cs:line 1131
   at System.Linq.Enumerable.WhereEnumerableIterator`1.MoveNext()
   at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Activities.MoveAdjacentTo.CalculatePathToTarget(Actor self)
   at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Activities.MoveAdjacentTo.<>c__DisplayClass2.<Tick>b__0()
   at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Activities.Move.EvalPath()
   at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Activities.Move.Tick(Actor self)
   at OpenRA.Traits.ActivityUtils.RunActivity(Actor self, Activity act) in d:\OpenRA-AS-dev\OpenRA.Game\Traits\ActivityUtils.cs:line 37
   at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Activities.MoveAdjacentTo.Tick(Actor self)
   at OpenRA.Traits.ActivityUtils.RunActivity(Actor self, Activity act) in d:\OpenRA-AS-dev\OpenRA.Game\Traits\ActivityUtils.cs:line 37
   at OpenRA.Actor.Tick() in d:\OpenRA-AS-dev\OpenRA.Game\Actor.cs:line 164
   at OpenRA.World.Tick() in d:\OpenRA-AS-dev\OpenRA.Game\World.cs:line 331
   at OpenRA.Game.InnerLogicTick(OrderManager orderManager) in d:\OpenRA-AS-dev\OpenRA.Game\Game.cs:line 556
   at OpenRA.Game.LogicTick() in d:\OpenRA-AS-dev\OpenRA.Game\Game.cs:line 581
   at OpenRA.Game.Loop() in d:\OpenRA-AS-dev\OpenRA.Game\Game.cs:line 708
   at OpenRA.Game.Run() in d:\OpenRA-AS-dev\OpenRA.Game\Game.cs:line 748
   at OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args) in d:\OpenRA-AS-dev\OpenRA.Game\Support\Program.cs:line 118
   at OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args) in d:\OpenRA-AS-dev\OpenRA.Game\Support\Program.cs:line 40
```

data.title: Requires<> is bogus.
data.body:
As my recent modding experiments uncovered it, `Requires<>` turned out to be bogus. If the required trait has multiple instances on the actual actor and the trait which is required is placed between them, `Requires<>` will not force the followup instances to be loaded before the trait which requires them.

Testcase in bleed TS: add `AutoTarget` between the two `Attack*` traits to the Tick Tank (`ttnk`). The game won't crash. Add it to the end of the unit and the game will crash due to `AutoTarget` is still incapable of handling more `Attack*` traits. `AutoTarget` requires `AttackBase`.

data.title: ColorValidator should be moved to a trait and made optional.
data.body:
As a prerequisite to #9684 we need to decouple the color validator from the tileset, which is best done by moving it to a trait and defining per-tileset restricted colors (populated with the main terrain colors) as a trait property.

While we are there, we should expose a lobby option to enable/disable the validator, and _disable it by default_.  This should fix the last of the complaints that people have against it, while keeping it available for people/situations where it is useful.

data.title: Fix coverity issues
Refactor projectiles
data.body:
```
[17:58] <+pchote> tbh, I think we've reached the point where our projectile abstraction has fallen apart
[17:58] <+pchote> we have stupid duplication between things that do the same thing, and arbitrary limitations between things that don't
[17:59] <+pchote> projectiles would be the better place, but that will mean duplicating it
[18:00] <+pchote> IMO we need a new framework for projectiles
[18:01] <+pchote> with swappable trait-like modules
[18:01] <+pchote> making them actors would be one option, but maybe a bit extreme
[18:02] <+pchote> at the very least I think we should have a base Projectile type, with ProjectileTraits for things like rendering (voxel/sprite/nothing), contrails, locomotor, etc
[18:03] <+pchote> but if we made them actors then they could directly use the existing rendering/contrail/etc traits
```

data.title: Restore the ability for maps to include inline rules.
data.body:
Removing support for inline yaml rules etc was a little premature: we need this feature for the server-resource center integration.  It therefore makes sense to bring this back for regular maps too.

This mostly reverts the changes to the importers and format upgrader to keep the custom rules in map.yaml.  The TS lighting definitions have been moved back as a testcase because it was a little silly to have a 3-4 line single-trait override in its own file.

data.title: Remove Map usage from the server and mission browser.
data.body:
This adds support for loading map rules from a `MapPreview`, and removes the last uses of `Map` from places that don't actually want a full map object.  This makes the mission browser a bit smoother (the video button and description are now available instantly), and, once support is added to the resource center, give servers access to all the maps available on the resource center without having to manually sync.

This also checks off another major point in #10717, and means that we can now streamline Map initialization by dropping all the `Lazy`ness.

data.title: Allow multiple AttackTurreted traits.
data.body:
This is something really important for a faction of mine (+ various random other units).

Public testcase will come soon in the form of the RA2 IFV.

data.title: Streamline effects
data.body:
Unless I overlooked something, the `Smoke` and `Explosion` effects do nothing (except the recently introduced facings support on `Smoke`) that the generic `SpriteEffect` can't do as well.

I suggest adding facing support to `SpriteEffect` and get rid of `Smoke` and `Explosion`.

data.title: Add support for multiple map categories.
data.body:
This is the final backwards-incompatible change that I'd like to propose for the next release.  I've split it into its own PR because it depends on resource center changes that may not happen immediately (it needs to be able to parse and expose the categories via the map API).

This replaces the map `Type` field with a list of `Categories`, where the first category is treated as the main map type, and remaining categories are used for filtering the map chooser.  As a test case I have updated and added categories for the TS maps; this will currently break the other mods (updating those now would just end up with rebase conflicts while we wait for the resource center changes).

Depends on #10839. Only the last four commits are new.

data.title: Clean up map tileset references.
data.body:
The last few PRs have untangled the map format to the point that we can now start dropping the ugly workarounds that were in place for perf or sanity reasons.  This PR makes a start by unifying the tileset references into a single Map.Tileset property.

Depends on #10839.  Only the last two commits are new.

data.title: "Disable shellmap" and it should still at least show a still image.
data.body:
Better then just a black screen maybe?

Still waiting on that "mute shellmap" option.

data.title: Make mammoth tanks capable of crushing concrete walls
data.body:
Like the do in TD.

CC @SoScared, @kyrylo (as this was suggested on stream, too).

data.title: Trails with facings still 'listen' to parent actor/projectile after being spawned
data.body:
I didn't notice this before, but this is a potential show-stopper.

Basically, if the parent actor/projectile changes facing, not only newly spawned smoke, but also any remaining smoke effects that were spawned eariler instantly change to the same facing.

That's bogus, but I have yet to figure out how to fix it.

data.title: Fix an exploit were players were able to repair at enemy service depots
data.body: Just ping me in IRC if you want to know how to trigger the exploit (I'm not sure if I should post that in public, although it's not too game breaking).

data.title: WithDecorations specified only for Neutral and Enemy stances are visible to spectators
data.body: This is a regression, but uncertain if caused by fragile alliances removal or the WithDecoration refactor.

data.title: Fix players being able to command allied units to the service depot
data.body:
Fixes #10888.

You can also now use the repair cursor to order your units to allied repair pads, when you don't have one yourself (it'll drain your cash anyway).

data.title: [BUG] Repairing an enemy unit with the repair icon causes "Client exploit" server message
data.body:
[01:44] <AMHOL> You guys know why in a team game, if I try to repair an enemy unit by accident (like when you do your own and it sends them to the service depot), there's a server message, "Repair exploit detected by client N"
[01:45] <+chrisf> AMHOL: bug.
[01:45] <+chrisf> AMHOL: it shouldnt be issuing the order at all, but there's a missing check
[01:45] <+chrisf> AMHOL: please file a bug.

data.title: Un-deploying conyard removes all targets
data.body: If you target an enemy conyard and they un-deploy it, the MCV is treated as a new unit so your units un-target it, this is very annoying for air units (especially fast ones like migs and yaks) and annoying for a ground army which normally just target the nearest harvester leaving the MCV to get away.

data.title: Fix GravityBomb crash when Image is null
data.body:
Additionally,
- changed impact check to use `DistanceAboveTerrain` instead of `.Z`
- made shadow palette configurable

Closes  #10883.

data.title: Prevent locked spawns from being selected by other players.
data.body:
Fixes #10230.

A future PR (which depends on the ongoing map format cleanups) will be able to hide these invalid spawns from the lobby GUI.  For now, the error message will have to do.

data.title: Revert "Added Keybord input filter to only register first key press."
data.body:
Reverts #9791.
Fixes #10734.
Reopens #9737

data.title: GravityBomb cannot lack an image.
data.body: It crashes when firing the default value of null. The common projectiles (Missile and Bullet) do not.

data.title: Test the main game directory's mod subdirectory for write permissions
data.body:
And add the result to the system information query.

To (eventually) settle the argument that took place on IRC tonight.

data.title: Inability to spam "building placement" shortcuts on bleed
data.body:
Hey! Sorry for a possible duplicate, but it's pretty hard to search for this kind of issue (and also hard to describe it).

On bleed, I noticed you can't keep the "E" button ("R", "T", etc) pressed to spam the "place building" command. That is, on current release you can press "E" while producing a building, which will trigger an infinite "switch tab" sound and as soon as your building is ready, you will be able to put it on the map. I have recorded this technique recently, so the video illustrates what I am talking about (mind the timestamp): https://youtu.be/P0fj_h_JxD4?t=2m48s 

Was it intentional? Can we bring this behaviour back? It's actually very useful.
